snippet: It remains to be seen is whether Senator Ted Cruz can translate his popularity into votes when Texas holds its presidential primary.
abstract: Sen Ted Cruz opens presidential campaign headquarters in Texas, where he enjoys significant popularity; it remains unclear whether he can carry state's voters in primary that is likely to be crowded with rivals who share Texas's Lone Star sensibility, including former Gov Rick Perry, Jeb Bush and Kentucky Sen Rand Paul.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and NICK CORASANITI

lead_paragraph: It remains to be seen is whether Senator Ted Cruz can translate his popularity into votes when Texas holds its presidential primary.

headline.main: A Base in Texas Is No Guarantee of Lone Star Status for Ted Cruz
headline.print_headline: A Base in Texas Is No Guarantee of Lone Star Status for Cruz
